definition: surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: Narrow heritabilities of rows per ear and plant height are higer than 50%.
sentences.chinese: 穗行數和株高的狹義遺傳力超過了50%。

sentences.english: But those restrictions should be compelling and very narrowly defined.
sentences.chinese: 但是，這些限制應具有說服力和狹義的定義。

sentences.english: The passive sentence in this paper is the narrow sense and notational Chinese passive sentence.
sentences.chinese: 本文所考察的，是漢語中有標記的狹義被動句。

sentences.english: Yet only the economic in the narrow sense will allow usto get beyond the economic.
sentences.chinese: 目前只有在狹義的經濟學中允許我們超脫於經濟學。

sentences.english: The concept of right should be understood from both broad sense and narrow sense .
sentences.chinese: 法權概念應從廣義及狹義層面上理解。

sentences.english: Clinically narrow sense of pelvic infection refers to tubal phlogistic.
sentences.chinese: 臨牀上狹義的盆腔炎指的是輸卵管炎。

sentences.english: The construction of campus network can' t be comprehended in the narrow sense.
sentences.chinese: 校園網絡的建設不能僅從狹義上去理解。

sentences.english: Dialect refers only to the narrow sense of drama.
sentences.chinese: 狹義的僅指方言劇情片。

sentences.english: ICT has a major effect on governance in both its broad and narrow sense. The Institute of Governance (Canada) believes that ICTs
sentences.chinese: ICT對與廣義和狹義上的統治均有大的影響。

sentences.english: I. Types of narrow-sense accusative subject sentence in newspaper news lead.
sentences.chinese: 報紙新聞導語狹義受事主語句的構成成分分析。

sentences.english: In a narrow sense, it only refers to serve the public.
sentences.chinese: 狹義的社會服務職能僅指服務公衆。

sentences.english: Michelson and Morley had sounded the prelude to special relativity.
sentences.chinese: 邁克耳孫和莫雷已經奏出了狹義相對論的序曲。

sentences.english: For the general heritability, maternal and cytoplasm heritabilities were the main components for palmitic, oleic and linolenic acids contents.
sentences.chinese: 棕櫚酸含量和油酸含量是以普通狹義遺傳率爲主。

sentences.english: The so called "isles connection project" is subject to two interpretations.
sentences.chinese: 所謂“連島工程”，有廣義和狹義的區別。

definition: to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to differentiate/to draw a distinction/to divide into categories
to be collectively called/collective term/general designation
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
established by popular usage (idiom); common usage agreement/customary convention
to be generally referred to (as)/generic term
meaning (implicit in a phrase)/implied meaning/hidden meaning/hint/connotation
